The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in the Namib Desert. When the find them, the crew are found in an abandoned missle silo with a giant hole in the roof and the crew comment that there had been giant eagle-like creatures flying above them.
They experience kidnappings and archaeological sabotage as well as being chased into underground caverns and caves by a predatory race of sand pterodactyls

I saw it tonight and fell asleep in the movie.

That is something that I have not done since - I have never fallen asleep at a cinema before. How was the movie? Fall asleep is good. I was too sleepy in a screening room and people tap me on the shoulder and woke me up. While credited as a Tom and Jerry cartoon, this is not the cat-and-mouse team but an earlier Mutt-and-Jeff rip-off featuring them going about to survive in today's turbulent world. In the episode, titled MEAN SOCCER WEEK, the ball-playing Mutt's team gets kicked off the field by another group of stick players. Only through his wild play style Mutt can his cut-up team beat a far more normal football team of his worst enemies

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. The movie is pale, tiresome and poorly directed. But, thanks to the actors’ work, the spectators are attentive and follow the characters for 2 hours with interest.
1- When you are forewarned, you will enjoy the movie with participants. The shooting and the sound. But that’s all.

What is left of Planet Earth is populated by a few poor and starving rag-tag survivors. They must eat bugs and insects, or whatever they can find. The wealthy elite of the world (Rockefellars, Jesuits, Savedtime, Andrews, and so forth) have survived by becoming vampires and dish out heavily enforced penalty killings to the rest of the humans. Yet, the unthinkable has happened a group affected by a sort of vampire mutation has become

Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is going to score big time with martial arts aficionados has just the right amount of everything to please. Ninja and karate fans will have a grand time with this one and it is chock full of satisfying martial arts battles with numerous ninjas and other assorted bad guys of all kind
